Senior Software Engineer at Google (~10 years). I have worked across multiple Google 
products like AdSpam, YouTube, Discover, etc. and have built a repertoire of skills in 
design, implementation, testing and maintenance of large scale software systems.
Looking for opportunities to tackle challenging new technical problems.
EMPLOYMENT HISTORY
Software Engineer at Google, Mountain View
September 2016 — Present
•Ranking and Signals creation for Videos in Google Discover:  Improved the quality 
and quantity of videos being served with better flavor and relevance to users.
•Creator Insights in YouTube: Designed and implemented. Project was aimed at 
detecting and diagnosing anomalies in the performance of recently uploaded 
videos within hours of publish to help the YT creator community.
•Backpay 2.0 in YouTube:  Aimed at resolving revenue share claims on monetized 
videos that face contention over the video’s ownership e.g. copyright claim.
•Project Beane in YouTube:  Revamped how revenue gets allotted to videos. 
Pre-beane, all ads shown on a video contribute to video’s revenue but as part of 
this, everything was to become pool based payment system to promote fairness 
based on content instead of ad lucrativeness across YouTube.
Trust and Safety Engineer at Google India, Hyderabad
September 2013 — August 2016
•Project Purple: Increases awareness of users’ top issues and to capture the essence 
of users’ feedbacks to provide an early warning system for discovering new abuse 
trends to act upon across all products.
•Mobile Cloaking Detection:  Provides support for PQO (Product Quality Operations) 
to deal with cloaking abuse on the Google products by providing an efficient 
screenshot-ing system based on physical devices placed at multiple locations with 
carrier support.

•ScaM based suscipicious publisher flagging:  This allowed analysts to generate 
traffic pattern based leads in real time (in a second) by going over millions of 
publishers based on suspicious behavior signals.
Software Engineer Intern at Microsoft, Hyderabad
May 2012 — July 2012
•Unified Test Beds: Developing a service, in the Bing team, for the automated test 
framework across multiple servers for quicker and more reliable deployments.
